articles.title: Saudi Arabia def Argentina, Lionel Messi nightmare, reaction, video, highlights, result
articles.description: Now it gets Messi: Five-minute disaster for world’s best player as World Cup fairytale in tatters
articles.content:
It wasn’t meant to be like this for Lionel Messi.
Considered by many as the world’s greatest player, the Argentina playmaker has suffered a nightmare start to the World Cup in Qatar.
And if a picture can say a thousand words, then you only need to lo... [3392 chars]

articles.title: Saudi Arabia beat Argentina in one of the biggest upsets in World Cup history
articles.description: Lionel Messi scored early but the match turned on its head in a crazy five minutes in the second half.
articles.content:
Saudi Arabia have produced one of the biggest upsets in World Cup history to beat Argentina 2-1 in their group C opener with goals by Saleh Al-Shehri and Salem Al-Dawsari stunning the favourites.
The 51st-ranked Saudis were trailing to Lionel Messi’s... [824 chars]

articles.title: Saudi Arabia put Argentina 'on the ropes' and strike twice after half-time to take shock lead following Lionel Messi's early penalty in World Cup group stage opener

articles.content:
Saudi Arabia stunned World Cup favourites Argentina in their World Cup clash after scoring twice in quick succession to take a 2-1 lead.
The South Americans went into the break 1-0 up through Lionel Messi’s 10th minute penalty and were well on top.

articles.title: Soccer-Former Argentina striker Aguero says he was denied access to team camp
articles.description: The 34-year-old said he wanted to wish his countrymen luck before they opened their campaign but was told the right accreditation could not be arranged in time for him to meet his former team mates. "I haven't seen the Argentina team yet.
articles.content:
Former Argentina forward Sergio Aguero criticised his country's football association (AFA) after he was denied entry to the team's World Cup training base ahead of their group stage opener against Saudi Arabia on Tuesday.

articles.description: Argentina were awarded a penalty by VAR in their World Cup opener but Graeme Souness and Roy Keane failed to see eye-to-eye on it.
articles.content:
Graeme Souness and Roy Keane's half-time analysis descended into a war of words during Argentina's World Cup opener, as the pair failed to agree on a VAR decision.
